medical_history.chief_complaint: Fever, worsening renal function, and confusion.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began approximately 1 week before admission with subjective fevers and increased urinary frequency, partially improved after prescribed nitrofurantoin. Fatigue and increasing somnolence developed 2 days before admission, followed by confusion and a fever of 39.1Â°C.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Chronic renal disease, renal obstruction, recurrent urinary tract infections, hypercholesterolemia, hypertension, paroxysmal atrial fibrillation, premature ventricular contractions, allergic rhinitis, basal-cell carcinoma, and orthopedic injuries from a motor vehicle accident. Previous photoselective vaporization of the prostate two months prior.
medical_history.family_history: Father and paternal grandfather had heart disease; mother died in her 30s of an intracerebral hemorrhage.
medical_history.social_history: Married, worked in an office, lived in an urban area of New England, moderate alcohol consumption, no smoking or illicit drug use, and recent travel to a forested region with heavy tick and mosquito burdens.
